bill_title: prohibit certain incentives and punishments in association with school surveys, and to impose a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit certain incentives and punishments in association with school surveys, and to impose a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 13-3-51.2 be amended to read: 13-3-51.2. No elementary school or secondary school student shall be required to submit to a survey, analysis, or evaluation that reveals information concerning: (1) Political affiliations or beliefs of the student or the student's parent; (2) Mental or psychological problems or aspects of the student or the student's family; (3) Sex behavior or attitudes of the student or the student's family; (4) Illegal, anti-social, self-incriminating, or demeaning behavior; (5) Critical appraisals of other individuals with whom respondents have close family relationships; (6) Legally recognized privileged or analogous relationships, such as those of lawyers, physicians, and ministers; (7) Religious practices, affiliations, or beliefs of the student or student's parent; (8) Personal or family gun ownership; or (9) Income (other than that required by law to determine eligibility for participation in a program or for receiving financial assistance under such the program); without the prior consent of the student (if the student is an adult or emancipated minor), or in the case of an unemancipated minor, without the prior written consent of the parent. The list of information in subdivisions (1) to (9), inclusive, is not an exclusive list. The secretary of the Department of Education may add to the list of information in subdivisions (1) to (9), inclusive, other data, facts, or information that is of a similar nature that a student may not be required to disclose. No teacher, school administrator, or any other person may offer any incentive to any student or parent in association with a survey. No student may be punished for not participating in a survey. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. The term, parent, for purposes of this section, includes a legal guardian or other person standing in loco parentis. Nothing in this section is intended to supersede or modify any other state law or any provision in 20 U.S.C. § 1232h or 34 C.F.R. Part 98, as amended to January 1, 2014.
